attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Stop parking charges at hospitals for visitors & staff, charges for TV & phone
attributes.background: I have been in hospital several times, cost £1.60 per hr, £7.50 per day for TV, 3 minute phone call cost £2.00. I am an OAP and cannot afford these prices.
attributes.additional_details: Being old I am in and out of hospital

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Make Asthma Medication Available over the Counter at a Pharmacy
attributes.background: Being Asthmatic, its hard to judge when your medication will run out as some days you need more medication than others. If you run out you have to wait 48 hours form your GP to get a new prescription or please with a pharmacist to loan you one or sell you one. Asthmatics need direct access to meds.
attributes.additional_details: If you run out GP is closed and a pharmacist wont sell you one, you have two options, go to a walk in centre where they can treat you if you are having an attack, but not supply you with meds. Or you can go to hospital, where you will be warded, nebulised, be given a full examination and chest x ray and then be prescribed an inhaler. Making asthma medication available will save money for the NHS and let people breathe when they need to. Chemists will sell you Viagra but not an inhaler!

attributes.action: 65 and over to retake driving test or top up test
attributes.background:
The driving test now is near impossible.  Most failing at least once. 50 years ago the test was a completely different story, no theory test and nowhere near as strict. 
As well as a lack of road knowledge, unfortunately their age has a side effect on other road users causing traffic and accidents.

attributes.action: UK Government to outlaw the building of homes on land contaminated by asbestos.
attributes.background: The Turner Brothers Asbestos plant in Rochdale was the world's foremost manufacturer of asbestos for 100 years. The land is contaminated. To build housing there would be of severe detriment to public health and the environment.

attributes.action: Give pensioners with Annuities or annuity based products access to their cash.
attributes.background: This does not mean  creating a second hand market but where two parties agree ie the Provider and customer remove the unauthorised payment charge of 55% by a simple change in legislation .

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pay for parking where you work.
attributes.background: Companies should not make their employees pay for parking where they work, it is unfair and you are basically paying to be at work. Car parks are charging ridiculous amounts which takes a lot of money from your wage at the end of the month.

attributes.action: Plan a 70th Anniversary Festival of Britain as a Beacon for Change; post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
In 1951 the Festival of Britain celebrated British industry, arts and science and inspiring the thought of a better Britain during a period of turmoil and austerity.
In 2021 we can embrace the post-brexit change, remind ourselves and the rest of the world who we are and what we do as a nation.
attributes.additional_details:
The 1951 festival was a showcase of Britain’s finest architecture, technology, design, fashion, science, arts, manufacturing and creative industries to convince the nation during a period of austerity and turmoil that the future was not so bleak and that they were entering the age of modernity.

Historian Kenneth O. Morgan says the 1951 Festival was a "triumphant success". The Festival made a spectacular setting as a showpiece for the inventiveness and genius of British scientists and technologists.

For many similar reasons, we should do this again in 2021 following the Brexit divorce. This is also an opportunity to detract from the fractious negotiations of Brexit and unite behind a common goal over the next 4 years.

attributes.action: Lift the ban of Pit bulls and other dogs affected by BSL in the UK
attributes.background: Many innocent breeds of dogs have been banned from the UK on grounds of them being dangerous - but the animals aren't dangerous and I refuse to allow the government to ban an innocent animal purely because of previous criminal owners forcing them into violence
attributes.additional_details: I know many people are aware of BSL (Breed Specific Legislation) making specifics breeds of dogs banned purely because they could be deemed as dangerous, but I bet you didn't know that in 2015, Jack Russels were the breed most likely to bite in the city of Liverpool (according to police in Liverpool). Furthermore, your household best friend - the Labrador - is also responsible for the highest number of canine attacks according to the pet insurers Animal Friends.

attributes.action: A parking bay should have legal standard size of 3 meters
attributes.background: Parking bays are too small and you can't get out you car once parked. I'm disabled and find it hard to get out my car when I can't find a disabled parking bay, because they're all taken. I'd like to see a legal minimum size bay of 3 meters since most car parks charge

attributes.action: Pensions for nurses Who have worked forty years and are over sixty
attributes.background:
Nurses over sixty are struggling to work in physically exhausting jobs.
We nursed in the seventies lifting heavy patients without hoists.
We used the Austrailian lift where we literally lifted the patient on our backs.
Long term hard physical and emotional nursing takes its toll.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of my friends are nurses, none of them have been able to keep going.
Let us have our state pension that we worked so hard for.
 I didn't expect to be in this position after forty five years of hard physical work I need dignity in retirement.

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: A deal between Australia and the UK for less restrictive working visas.
attributes.background: As a British Citizen currently living in Australia on a working holiday visa, I believe that the current visa limitations are detrimental for the two nations who would both profit from a more relaxed movement of labour between the the two nations. With Brexit looming this could fill a lost skill gap
attributes.additional_details: Currently obtaining a sponsorship to continue working in Australia is difficult and costly to obtain. Likewise for Australians trying to live and work in the U.K. It's costly and difficult. The commonwealth should be utilised more to benefit the citizens and the countries involved.

attributes.action: All new members of the House of Lords should sit for 10 years
attributes.background:
The present House of Lords has been a mockery for many many years.viz Iolanthe written in the 1800s. Major reform is unlikely. However my minor change would, in due time, reduce the numbers.
It should not be difficult to make this change.

attributes.action: New generation social housing policy
attributes.background: It is an issue close to many of our hearts that too many people are without affordable and safe accommodation. That as a country we are not doing enough to provide affordable housing, specialist housing units for under 25's, mother and baby units for our future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a new policy dictating:-

- Housing to be provided only to those with 10+ years in the UK
- New Decent Homes Standards
- Rent assessed on affordability with a baseline on each property
- Annual property reviews including tenancy and accommodation
- New Tenancy Groups which deal with localised property repair issues
- More specialised properties including low rent properties, young peoples living, over 50's & mother and baby units
- New Housing Officer Role & Training

attributes.action: The formation of a Sikh regiment in the British army.
attributes.background: Over 250,000 sikhs fought in the world wars under the British Empire, with many men being awarded the Victoria cross for their bravery. The British army quite rightly recognises Nepalese (Gurkhas) soliders and it is only right the sacrifice of the sikhs is honoured by forming a Sikh regiment.

attributes.action: Introduce a compulsory quiet time every day to avoid noise pollution for all.
attributes.background: In other countries there are certain times of day when noise pollution is against the law. We would all benefit from knowing we can look forward to a certain time of day when we can be sure we won't be disturbed by other's noise.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on abolishing the British Monarchy
attributes.background: Currently, Britain has an unelected Head of State who is unelected and unaccountable. The Queen has rule over all laws that are made in the UK, but doesn't even help make them in the first place. She has consistently shown a lack of any leadership; recently in regards to Donald Trump's state visit.
attributes.additional_details: The Queen has to pass every law made and has the power to veto them. This is not democracy, this is proof that Britain is stuck in the past and desperately needs modernisation. After Britain voted to leave the EU, it is clear that we no longer want people who are unelected ruling over us. A referendum, whatever result is produced, will give the Queen a mandate to leave or lead; it is time to take back democracy.

attributes.action: Use our "special relationship" to persuade Trump to release his tax returns now.
attributes.background: The ordinary man has to pay tax, and has no choice in the matter. President Trump, as the leader of the free world, should set the example. He has claimed he paid millions in taxes, but has never proved it - Now he is president he should release his tax returns to back up his claims.

attributes.action: Make it that child maintenance payments come with visitation rights.
attributes.background: I pay maintenance for my children but still get stopped from seeing them. If the other parent takes payment from you you are entitled to see them without a court order if you are stopped from seeing them then payments should be reduced

attributes.action: Add Welsh language education to the English school curriculum.
attributes.background: The Welsh language is spoken throughout both Wales and England and is arguably the native language of Great Britain, as well as 500,000 people. However, in England, the opportunity to learn Welsh is practically impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Give Welsh has an option in English schools to help promote cultural understand, give more people access to their ancestral language, help keep this magnificent language alive and create job opportunities for Welsh-speakers in England.

attributes.action: Accept 10,000 refugee families into the UK, instead of Donald Trump
attributes.background: Accept 10000 Vulnerable refugee families into the UK and settle them using the money That would be otherwise spent on Trumps state visit
attributes.additional_details: Accept 10,000 vulnerable refugee families with children into the uk, instead of having Donald Trump here for a state visit. The money we would spend on hosting Trump to be used to bring over / settle the refugee families into UK city's, help them to learn English and find jobs while accepting and embracing their culture

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Legalisation of Medical and Medicinal cannabis, in the United Kindom.
attributes.background: Report by Adam Smith Institute says UK’s drug strategy ‘has failed in its core aims’ and urges government to legalise cannabis
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis should be legalised in the UK, according to a report that has the backing of several cross-party MPs including the former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg.

Current cannabis policy in Britain is a “messy patchwork” of legislation intermittently enforced by regional police and an embarrassment, says the report by the free-market thinktank the Adam Smith Institute.

attributes.action: Ensure that a trade deal with the EU is a priority over a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: The PM is discussing trade deals with the US, the party have given the impression that a trade deal with the US will be a substitute for the current trade deal with the European Union. Many jobs and business rely on the current EU trade deal and would gain no benefit from a trade deal with the USA.

attributes.action: License all drone operators in the uk
attributes.background: Many drone owners operate their machines without training, are ignorant of the law and pose a danger to the well being and privacy of the general public. For those reasons they should be trained and licensed before flying these devices.

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.

attributes.action: I call for all census data to be published 80 years after the date of the census
attributes.background: The 1921 census to be published in 2021 will be the last for 30 years. The 1931 census was destroyed by fire and there wasn't a 1941 census due to World War 2. We should come into line with the American Federal Census whose 1950 census will be published in 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The 1951 census should be published in 2031 to keep the 10 continuity. The census period would then be every 80 years before publication. The average age of people living is between 70 and 80 years. So you wouldn't contravene privacy laws.

attributes.action: Make all injunctions free for those who are victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
My mum had been a victim of domestic violence for 20 years. A painful journey it had been. After finding the courage to leave she looked into implementing an injunction which was charged at £130 for each year. 
Victims are being left with an impossible choice save themselves or pay for the letter.
attributes.additional_details:
Injunction - An injunction is an equitable remedy in the form of a court order that compels a party to do or refrain from specific acts. A party that fails to comply with an injunction faces criminal or civil penalties, including possible monetary sanctions and even imprisonment. They can also be charged with contempt of court 

Wikipedia (2016) 'Injunction' available from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injunction

attributes.action: Make NHS must fund a life changing procedures for Gastroparesis patients.
attributes.background: My friend Nat 31 had a non-curable disease called Gastroparesis as well as EDS and P.O.T.S. for 8 years. Medication and feeding tubes have failed her and now the NHS are failing her with a simple hour procedure to have a pacemaker fitted to help regulate her stomach.
attributes.additional_details:
It costs the NHS more money to provide a bed, medication (which doesn't work) and feeding tubes which her body refuses. To have a Enterra stomach Pacemaker fitted costs privately between 10-20 thousand pounds. There is no comparison when someone's quality of life is at stake. 
 
Please please please help. Let's get this to parliament.

attributes.action: call for uk prime minister may, to go to parliament & answers for NHS crisis
attributes.background: The British people deserve answers on why our country's greatest asset the NHS is turning the British people away & or leaving them to die in corridors, & it takes Red Cross to call you out don't cut staff & budgets, sort this its our human rights, Pm & government it's your fault not anyone else's
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for prime minister Theresa May to go to parliament and give answer to the British tax payer and it's people this is a disgrace people are dieing, needlessly under your power and government you have a lot of questions to answer, and don't blame the British public or the staff nurses or doctors, you have made the cuts to staff and hospitals budgets. please get this petition as far as we can as a great country, we're living in 3rd world conditions it's a disgrace. Fund NHS

attributes.action: Ban fee paying 'private' schools so admission to all schools is based on merit.
attributes.background: Eton was founded in 1440, over 557 years ago. It is deplorable that we allow these schools to still operate in a society where they are totally out of place. When it comes to education, meritocracy is the most sensible answer. Keep Eton, the facility's, the teachers erase the price tag.
attributes.additional_details: Independent schools in the UK cost on average £13,000 a year per child, or 32.5% of the average two income household. This means that for the average citizen these schools are unfeasible. No wonder 27,000 children attending private schools are not UK citizens. This outrageously outdated system allows the elite to become richer, by granting them better educations. Oxford and Cambridge admit more Etonians each year than applicants from the whole country who qualify for free school meals, showing how these upper class elites can buy their way into life.
